lexUnit.name: set.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put, lay, or stand (something) in a specified place or position

sentence.text: Plumping up the pillows , she set them against the padded headrest and left , closing the door behind her .
Coventry put the kettle on the stove , put the teapot and the tea caddy and sugar on the table , and then took off his own perfectly dry shoes , and set them against the stove .
` Try that , " he recommended , setting it beneath her arm .
He baited his baskets and set them in the water , he was so cunning !
But he set her sideways on the broad saddle , swung himself up behind her , settled his hands around her waist .
The Keeper waited while the other Man closed the door behind him and then set the cage on the ground and let Minch free .
Duroc picked up his broad-brimmed black hat , and set it upon his head .
Cornelius lifted him down and set him upon the copper map .
He reached into his gaming box and brought forth a piece , setting it down on the board with a satisfied air .
He did not set the lamp there that way .
To his annoyance he found that the Treasurer 's office was now completely empty except for the four telephones set down in a row on the bare boards of the floor .
Mrs Stych had just set down the last of her bags of groceries on the kitchen counter and begun to unpack them , when there was the sound of a heavy truck drawing up outside her house .
The Brigadier set down a fat puppy that he had been holding and squelched towards the yard , driving a dozen pullets before him .
` Very well , " she said , setting down her trowel and taking off her gardening gloves .
He set down his sack and straightened his aching shoulders .
As I shakily set down my glass , with a new attack of the clammy sweats seeping into my shirt , things grew more terrifying .
She set down his drink so hard that it sloshed out of the glass .
Alix brought a chrome bowl out of an open cupboard , set it down ajangle with instruments of torture and turned on the generator for her machines .
Hennessy brought a chair of his own and set it down some distance away .
